intro: Exallage ciliicaulis, commonly known as the silky-fruited sedge, is a perennial plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in moist to wet environments, such as marshes and pond edges, and is often found in temperate regions. Its unique foliage and habitat preferences make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
